__data__.text: Initializes the SoftmaxRegression model by invoking the base class constructor and performing weight initialization.
Seeds NumPy's RNG, initializes the weight matrix W1 with small random values, and creates a corresponding gradient buffer.
Performs the forward pass to compute loss and accuracy; in training mode, also computes gradients for W1 via backpropagation and stores them in self.gradients.
Initializes the SoftmaxRegression model by invoking the base class constructor and performing weight initialization.
Placeholder for weight initialization to be implemented by subclasses.
Placeholder for the forward pass to be implemented by subclasses.
Computes numerically stable softmax probabilities from raw scores, returning (N, num_classes).
Computes mean cross-entropy loss given predicted probabilities and true labels, with clipping to avoid log(0).
Computes accuracy by comparing predicted class indices to true labels.
Applies the sigmoid activation elementwise to the input and returns the result.
Computes the derivative of the sigmoid function for the given input.
Applies the ReLU activation (max(0, x)) elementwise to the input.
Computes the derivative of ReLU, returning 1 for positive inputs and 0 otherwise.
Initialize network dimensions (input size, number of classes, hidden size), call base class constructor, store hidden size, and trigger weight initialization via _weight_init.

Initialize all weights and biases (W1, b1, W2, b2) with deterministic values (small random weights for W1, W2; zeros for biases); reset gradients (W1, b1, W2, b2) to zeros; uses fixed seeds to ensure reproducibility.

Perform a forward pass to compute Z1, A1 (hidden activation), Z2, and output probabilities; compute loss via cross-entropy and accuracy via predictions; perform backpropagation to compute gradients (dW2, db2, dW1, db1) and store them in self.gradients; return loss and accuracy. This function calls internal utilities like sigmoid, sigmoid_dev, softmax, cross_entropy_loss, and compute_accuracy.
Initialize the base network with input_size and num_classes and set up empty dictionaries for weights and gradients; prepares the object for subclassing. No return value.
Placeholder for weight initialization; intended to populate self.weights. No return value.
Placeholder for forward-pass logic to be implemented by subclasses. No return value.
Compute row-wise softmax on the input scores to produce probabilities; returns an (N, num_classes) matrix. No side effects beyond returning the probabilities.
Compute mean cross-entropy loss from predicted probabilities and true labels; returns a scalar loss value. No side effects besides returning the loss.
Compute accuracy by comparing predicted class indices (argmax over classes) with true labels; returns a scalar accuracy. No side effects beyond returning the accuracy.
Apply the sigmoid activation to the input X; returns an array of the same shape as X. No side effects.
Compute the derivative of the sigmoid function with respect to input x; returns an array of the same shape as x. No side effects.
Apply the ReLU activation to the input X; returns an array of the same shape as X. No side effects.
Compute the derivative of ReLU with respect to input X; returns 1.0 where X > 0 and 0.0 otherwise. No side effects.
Initialize the base network with default input size and number of classes, and create dictionaries for weights and gradients; does not perform full network setup beyond basic configuration.
Placeholder for weight initialization to be implemented by subclasses; currently does nothing.
Placeholder for the forward pass to be implemented by subclasses; currently does nothing.
Convert raw class scores to probabilities using a numerically stable softmax along the class axis; returns probabilities with shape (N, num_classes).
Compute the mean cross-entropy loss from predicted probabilities and true labels; clips probabilities to avoid log(0) and returns a scalar loss.
Compute accuracy by comparing predicted class indices (argmax) to true labels and returning a scalar accuracy.
Apply the sigmoid activation element-wise to the input and return the transformed array.
Compute the derivative of the sigmoid activation by evaluating sigmoid(x) and returning s * (1 - s).
Apply the ReLU activation (max(0, x)) element-wise and return the result.
Compute the derivative of ReLU, returning 1 for positive inputs and 0 otherwise.
Return a fixed greeting string used to verify module import in testing.
Initialize the base network with default input size and number of classes; store input_size, num_classes, and initialize empty dictionaries for weights and gradients.
Placeholder for weight initialization; currently no implementation and intended to be overridden by subclasses.
Placeholder for forward-pass logic; intended to be implemented by subclasses.
Compute numerically stable softmax probabilities from raw scores (N, num_classes); returns (N, num_classes).
Compute mean cross-entropy loss from predicted probabilities (N, num_classes) and true labels y (length N); clips probabilities to avoid log(0).
Compute accuracy by comparing predicted class indices (argmax over classes) to true labels y; returns a scalar accuracy.
Apply element-wise sigmoid activation to input X (N, layer size); returns (N, layer size).
Compute the derivative of the sigmoid function for input x; returns ds = s * (1 - s) where s = sigmoid(x).
Apply ReLU activation to input X (N, layer size); returns (N, layer size).
Compute the gradient of ReLU with respect to input X; returns 1.0 where X > 0, else 0.
